 If you are using your mobile device to navigate through the Chinese curriculum, you can type Pinyin and Chinese characters directly using freeCodeCamp's custom inputs. However, if you'd like to use the Chinese keyboard on your device, here's how to set it up.
 
-## On Android  
+## Adding Language Keyboards  
 
-1. Open **Settings**.
+### On Android
 
-2. Go to **System > Keyboard > On-screen keyboard**.
+**NOTE:** The Android path is not universal and may vary depending on the device.
 
-3. Choose your keyboard app, like Gboard.
+1. Open Settings.
 
-4. Tap **Languages**.
+2. Go to System (or General Management, depending on the device).
 
-5. Add **Chinese (Simplified)**.
+3. Tap Keyboard settings (or Languages & input).  
 
-6. Tap **Done** to finish.  
+4. Tap Languages and types (or Add keyboard). 
+ 
+5. Turn on Chinese (Simplified or CN) or download it if needed.  
 
-*Note:* Menu names may vary slightly on different Android devices.
+6. Save or tap Done, if prompted.
 
-## On iPhone  
+### On iPhone
 
-1. Open **Settings**.
+1. Open Settings.
 
-2. Go to **General > Keyboard**.
+2. Go to General > Keyboard.
 
-3. Tap **Keyboards**, then **Add New Keyboard**.
+3. Tap Keyboards.
 
-4. Select **Chinese (Simplified) â€“ Pinyin**.
+4. Tap Add New Keyboard.  
 
-5. Use the globe icon on your keyboard to switch between language layouts.
+5. Select Chinese (simplified).  
+
+6. Use the globe icon on the keyboard to switch languages.
